Penalty drama seals Cup win for Vanbrugh

Vanbrugh were crowned College Cup champions after they prevailed over Halifax in a dramatic penalty shootout

College Cup Final: As it happened

Join the Nouse Sport team on the sidelines for the College Cup 2012 Final. Kick off at 3pm

Goodricke victorious in College Rugby Competition

Goodricke were crowned champions in the College Rugby Competition with a last-gasp 10-7 win over Halifax today

Halifax and Goodricke on top in college rugby

Halifax and Goodricke came out on top in a thrilling first day of this weekend's college rugby competition

Beadle jubilant as Halifax book their place in the College Cup final

In the second semi final of the College Cup 2012, Halifax narrowly defeated James to ensure they would have a chance to defend their title against Vanbrugh in the final

Langwith suffer penalty heartache to send Wentworth through

Despite not enjoying the best of the game, Wentworth seconds edged their way into the Plate final after producing an almost perfect set of penalties against Langwith firsts

Wilson the hero as Vanbrugh win in shootout drama

Vanbrugh captain James Wilson saved three and scored one, as Vanbrugh prevailed over Derwent in a dramatic penalty shootout to book their place in the College Cup Final

College Cup Semi Finals Preview

Dan Holland and Luke Gardener look ahead to this week's two heavyweight College Cup semi final matches (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Halifax seconds victorious in college hockey

Halifax seconds overcame the odds to defeat Halifax firsts 2-1 to take the Hockey College Cup crown, in a dramatic final weekend in the competition (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

New event combines University and college rugby

University rugby players will be provided the chance to represent their colleges in the inaugural College Competition this weekend (Thumbnail credit Image: Agatha Torrance)

Burning Ambition

York Sport President and Olympic Torchbearer Sam Asfahani speaks to Dan Holland about legacies and the impact of the Games (Thumbnail credit Image: Bryan Burke via flickr Creative Commons)

My sporting experiences at York

Luke Gardener reflects on his three years of sport at York

Awards honour sporting achievements

The pick of the University of York's sporting talent were honoured at the York Sport Dinner on Sunday, with the annual York Sport Awards handed out (Thumbnail credit Image: Andy Davis)

Overnight badminton a success for RAG

Dedicated badminton players took part in an epic overnight session last weekend to raise money for RAG

Hull want KC Stadium for Varsity

The University of Hull could host the White Rose Varsity tournament next year and are hoping to secure the KC Stadium as a potential venue (Thumbnail credit Image: Jason Gillyon via flickr Creative Commons)

Vanbrugh thirds edge Wentworth to seal Plate final spot

Vanbrugh thirds continued their remarkable form, beating Wentworth firsts 1-0 to reach the Plate final today

Cat-like Cheshire saves Langwith's Plate hopes

In a dreary game on the JLD, in which the weather was markedly more interesting than the play, Langwith came out on top thanks to their composure in a penalty shootout

Routine win for Vanbrugh completes semi final line-up

Vanbrugh firsts will face Derwent in the College Cup semi-finals after a 3-0 victory over Goodricke on the JLD today

Vanbrugh thirds edge Derwent to secure Plate progression

Tom Fisher's bizarre first half strike was enough to seal Vanbrugh thirds' passage to the College Plate semi finals, as Derwent thirds crashed out

Firsts win in Halifax derby to reach Cup semis

Halifax firsts scored a 3-1 victory against Halifax seconds today, their fifth successive win taking them into the Cup semi finals

Derwent take narrow win in College Sports Day

Derwent emerged victorious in a hugely popular and dramatic College Sports Day, sealing a narrow win over James in one of the day's final events

US Open set to be full of surprises

Neil Johnston looks at the contenders for golf's US Open, with the action starting at the Olympic Club tomorrow (Thumbnail credit Last year's winner Rory McIlroy, Image: Ed (supergolfdude) via flickr Creative Commons)

Racket sports gear up for overnight RAG event

The badminton and squash clubs are set to embark on an overnight challenge to raise money for RAG this weekend (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Wentworth hit form to qualify for Plate semis

Although to date Wentworth have failed to impress in the College Cup, the odds of a victory in the Plate will have considerably shortened, as they produced as an impressively composed performance against Vanbrugh seconds today

Davies and Ferrao see James into the semi-finals

In the second quarter final of the College Cup, James firsts booked their place in the last four with an efficient performance against a resolute Halifax thirds team

Wentworth clinch unexpected victory via penalties

Wentworth seconds took their place in the Plate semi finals with a dramatic penalty shoot-out victory over Goodricke seconds

Derwent find form to reach semi finals

Derwent firsts booked a place in the College Cup semi finals with a convincing 4-0 win over Alcuin firsts today

Beacham provides welcome relief for Wentworth thirds

Wentworth thirds got the victory their perseverance deserved against a flaky Alcuin seconds. A Matt Beacham brace and one from the returning Bruce Rawlings were sufficient to secure their first points of the tournament in their final group game

Langwith forced to settle for Plate despite win

Langwith firsts made sure they finished third in Group 4 with a comfortable 2-0 win over Derwent thirds today

Last-minute Halifax seconds shock Vanbrugh

Halifax seconds struck late on to defeat a previously unbeaten Vanbrugh side and secure a place in the quarter finals of the Cup

Vanbrugh were crowned College Cup champions after they prevailed over Halifax in a dramatic penalty shootout
